org.openide.windows

Class TopComponent.SubComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openide.windows.TopComponent.SubComponent
  • Enclosing class:
    TopComponent

    public static final class TopComponent.SubComponent
extends Object
    Representation of a visual sub-component displayed in a TopComponent, for example sub-tabs in a multiview window.
    Since:
    6.52
    See Also:
    TopComponent.getSubComponents()

      C'tor

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubComponent

        public SubComponent(String displayName,
                    ActionListener activator,
                    boolean active)
        C'tor
        Parameters:
        displayName - Subcomponent's display name.
        activator - ActionListener to invoke when the sub-component needs to be actived.
        active - True if the given sub-component is currently active, e.g. multiview sub-tab is selected.

      • SubComponent

        public SubComponent(String displayName,
                    String description,
                    ActionListener activator,
                    boolean active)
        C'tor
        Parameters:
        displayName - Subcomponent's display name.
        description - Short description to show in a tooltip.
        activator - ActionListener to invoke when the sub-component needs to be actived.
        active - True if the given sub-component is currently active, e.g. multiview sub-tab is selected.

      • SubComponent

        public SubComponent(String displayName,
                    String description,
                    ActionListener activator,
                    boolean active,
                    Lookup lookup,
                    boolean showing)
        C'tor
        Parameters:
        displayName - Subcomponent's display name.
        description - Short description to show in a tooltip.
        activator - ActionListener to invoke when the sub-component needs to be actived.
        active - True if the given sub-component is currently active, e.g. multiview sub-tab is selected.
        lookup - the lookup of the given sub-component
        showing - True if the given sub-component is currently showing, e.g. multiview sub-tab is selected or part of a split.

    • Method Detail

      • getLookup

        public Lookup getLookup()
        Returns:
        the lookup of the given sub-component, could be null

      • isShowing

        public boolean isShowing()
        Returns:
        True if this sub-component is the active/selected one or part of a split.

      • isActive

        public final boolean isActive()
        Returns:
        True if this sub-component is the active/selected one.

      • getDescription

        public final String getDescription()

      • getDisplayName

        public final String getDisplayName()

      • activate

        public final void activate()
        Make this sub-component the active/selected one.
